## Description

[Amazon DynamoDB](https://aws.amazon.com/dynamodb) is a key-value and document database from Amazon Web Services.
The Amazon DynamoDB component allows you to create, read, update, or delete objects (items) within an Amazon DynamoDB database.

## Connections

### DynamoDB Access Key and Secret

An AWS IAM [access key pair](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_credentials_access-keys.html) is required to interact with Amazon DynamoDB.
Make sure that the key pair you generate in AWS has proper permissions to the DynamoDB resources you want to access.
Read more about DynamoDB IAM actions in the [AWS docs](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazondynamodb/latest/developerguide/api-permissions-reference.html).

<ComponentInputsTable
  inputs={[
    {
      placeholder: "Access Key ID",
      required: true,
      shown: true,
      comments: "An AWS IAM Access Key ID",
      example: "AKIAIOSFODNN7EXAMPLE",
      key: "accessKeyId",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Access Key ID",
    },
    {
      placeholder: "Secret Access Key",
      required: true,
      shown: true,
      comments: "An AWS IAM Secret Access Key",
      example: "wJalrXUtnFEMI/K7MDENG/bPxRfiCYEXAMPLEKEY",
      key: "secretAccessKey",
      type: "password",
      default: "",
      label: "Secret Access Key",
    },
  ]}
/>

### AWS Role ARN

To enable the IAM role authentication begin by logging into the [AWS Console](https://aws.amazon.com/) and navigate to Identity and Access Management (IAM).

To create an ARN user and generate credentials:

1. Navigate to Users and select **Create User**.

- Provide a User name and check the box providing them user access to the AWS Managment Console if needed.
- Once completed with the User creation, copy the ARN provided in the summary for a later step.

2. To obtain the ARN for an existing User, click on the designated username from the Users page and the ARN will be provided in the summary section.
3. From the summary section, select **Create access key**

- Select **Third-party service** as the access key type and select next.
- Set a description and select **create access key**.
- Copy the **Access Key** and **Secret access key** and enter those into the connection configuration of your integration along with the ARN.

To create and assign a user a role:

1. Navigate to Roles and select **Create Role**.

- Select **Custom Trust Policy** for the Trusted entity types
- Copy the following statement into the statement console. Making sure to replace the **ARN** with the user's actual ARN from the previous section

```json
{
  "Version": "2012-10-17",
  "Statement": [
    {
      "Effect": "Allow",
      "Principal": {
        "AWS": "ARN"
      },
      "Action": "sts:AssumeRole"
    }
  ]
}
```

- When adding permissions provide the **AmazonDynamoDBFullAccess** permission
- Complete remaining steps and select **Create Role**

<ComponentInputsTable
  inputs={[
    {
      placeholder: "Access Key ID",
      required: true,
      shown: true,
      comments: "An AWS IAM Access Key ID",
      example: "AKIAIOSFODNN7EXAMPLE",
      key: "accessKeyId",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Access Key ID",
    },
    {
      placeholder: "arn:aws:iam::OtherAccount-ID:role/assumed-role-name",
      required: true,
      shown: true,
      comments: "An AWS IAM Role ARN",
      example: "arn:aws:iam::OtherAccount-ID:role/assumed-role-name",
      key: "roleARN",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Role ARN",
    },
    {
      placeholder: "Secret Access Key",
      required: true,
      shown: true,
      comments: "An AWS IAM Secret Access Key",
      example: "wJalrXUtnFEMI/K7MDENG/bPxRfiCYEXAMPLEKEY",
      key: "secretAccessKey",
      type: "password",
      default: "",
      label: "Secret Access Key",
    },
  ]}
/>

## Actions

<div id="createtable" />

### Create Table

Create a new DynamoDB Table | <small><b>key: createTable</b></small>

<ComponentInputsTable
  inputs={[
    {
      language: "json",
      required: true,
      comments:
        "For each list item, provide a javascript object containing an attribute name, and an attribute type. The attribute type must be in the format that DynamoDB uses: N = number, S = string, L = Array etc...",
      key: "attributeDefinition",
      type: "code",
      default:
        '[\n  {\n    "AttributeName": "customerId",\n    "AttributeType": "N"\n  },\n  {\n    "AttributeName": "customerName",\n    "AttributeType": "S"\n  }\n]',
      label: "Attribute Definition",
    },
    {
      required: true,
      key: "awsConnection",
      type: "connection",
      label: "Connection",
    },
    {
      placeholder: "AWS Region",
      required: false,
      comments:

      required: true,
      language: "json",
      comments:
        "For each list item, provide a javascript object containing an attribute name, and a key type. The key type can either be a HASH or a RANGE key.",
      key: "keySchema",
      type: "code",
      default:
        '[\n  {\n    "KeyType": "HASH",\n    "AttributeName": "customerId"\n  },\n  {\n    "KeyType": "RANGE",\n    "AttributeName": "customerName"\n  }\n]',
      label: "Key Schema",
    },
    {
      required: true,
      example: "6000",
      comments:
        "One read capacity unit represents one strongly consistent read per second, or two eventually consistent reads per second, for an item up to 4 KB in size.",
      key: "readCapacityUnits",
      type: "string",
      default: "5",
      label: "Read Capacity Units",
    },
    {
      required: true,
      example: "Customers",
      comments:
        "Provide the name of the table you would like to interact with.",
      key: "tableName",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Table Name",
    },
    {
      required: true,
      example: "6000",
      comments:
        "One write capacity unit represents one write per second for an item up to 1 KB in size. If you need to write an item that is larger than 1 KB, DynamoDB must consume additional write capacity units.",
      key: "writeCapacityUnits",
      type: "string",
      default: "5",
      label: "Write Capacity Units",
    },
  ]}
/>

#### Output Example Payload

```
{
  "data": {
    "$metadata": {},
    "TableDescription": {
      "KeySchema": [],
      "ItemCount": 0,
      "TableName": "example",
      "TableArn": "example",
      "TableSizeBytes": 0,
      "TableStatus": "CREATING"
    }
  }
}
```

          value: "us-west-2",

      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "AWS Region",
    },
    {
      required: false,
      example: "Price > :limit",
      key: "conditionExpression",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Condition Expression",
    },
    {
      required: false,
      comments:
        "Expression attribute values in Amazon DynamoDB are substitutes for the actual values that you want to compare—values that you might not know until runtime. An expression attribute value must begin with a colon (:) and be followed by one or more alphanumeric characters.",
      key: "expressionAttributeValues",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      collection: "keyvaluelist",
      label: "Expression Attribute Values",
    },
    {
      required: false,
      model: [
        {
          label: "String",
          value: "S",
        },
        {
          label: "Number",
          value: "N",
        },
        {
          label: "Buffer",
          value: "B",
        },
        {
          label: "List/Array",
          value: "L",

          label: "Map/Object",

          label: "String Set",

          label: "Number Set",
          value: "NS",
        },
        {
          label: "Buffer Set",
          value: "BS",
        },
        {
          label: "Boolean",
          value: "BOOL",
        },
      ],
      comments:
        "The DynamoDB data type for each query param. You must specify a type for each Expression Attribute Value you provided.",
      key: "expressionAttributeValueTypes",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      collection: "keyvaluelist",
      label: "Expression Attribute Value Types",
    },
    {
      required: false,
      example: "Acme Inc",
      comments:
        "The value of the optional range key (sort key) to match. This is required if your table has a range key.",
      key: "rangeKeyValue",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Range / Sort Key Value",
    },
    {
      required: true,
      example: "Customers",
      comments:
        "Provide the name of the table you would like to interact with.",
      key: "tableName",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Table Name",
    },
    {
      required: true,
      example: "cust_1234",
      comments: "The value of the hash key (primary key) to match",
      key: "value",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Hash / Primary Key Value",
    },
  ]}
/>

#### Output Example Payload

```
{
  "data": {
    "$metadata": {},
    "TableDescription": {
      "AttributeDefinitions": [],
      "KeySchema": [],
      "ItemCount": 0,
      "TableName": "example",
      "TableArn": "example",
      "TableSizeBytes": 0,
      "TableStatus": "DELETING"
    }
  }
}
```

### Describe Table

Fetch metadata about an existing DynamoDB Table | <small><b>key: describeTable</b></small>

  inputs={[
    {
      required: true,

      key: "tableName",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Table Name",
    },
  ]}
/>

#### Output Example Payload

```
{
  "data": {
    "$metadata": {},
    "Table": {
      "AttributeDefinitions": [],
      "KeySchema": [],
      "ItemCount": 0,
      "TableName": "example",
      "TableArn": "example",
      "TableSizeBytes": 0,
      "TableStatus": "ACTIVE"
    }
  }
}
```

          label: "ap-south-2",
          value: "ap-south-2",

          label: "ap-southeast-1",

          label: "ap-southeast-2",

          label: "ca-central-1",

          label: "eu-central-1",

          label: "eu-central-2",

          label: "eu-north-1",

          label: "eu-south-1",
          value: "eu-south-1",

        {
          label: "eu-south-2",

          label: "eu-west-1",

          label: "us-gov-west-1",

        },
        {
          label: "us-west-1",
          value: "us-west-1",
        },
        {
          label: "us-west-2",
          value: "us-west-2",
        },
      ],
      key: "awsRegion",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "AWS Region",
    },
    {
      required: false,
      comments: "Enable debug mode to log additional information.",
      key: "debug",
      type: "boolean",
      default: "false",
      label: "Debug",
    },
    {
      required: false,
      comments:
        "Expression attribute values in Amazon DynamoDB are substitutes for the actual values that you want to compare—values that you might not know until runtime. An expression attribute value must begin with a colon (:) and be followed by one or more alphanumeric characters.",
      key: "expressionAttributeValues",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      collection: "keyvaluelist",
      label: "Expression Attribute Values",
    },
    {
      required: false,
      model: [
        {
          label: "String",
          value: "S",

        {
          label: "Number",

        {
          label: "Buffer",

        },
        {
          label: "Boolean",
          value: "BOOL",
        },
      ],
      comments:
        "The DynamoDB data type for each query param. You must specify a type for each Expression Attribute Value you provided.",
      key: "expressionAttributeValueTypes",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      collection: "keyvaluelist",
      label: "Expression Attribute Value Types",
    },
    {
      required: false,
      example: "contains (Subtitle, :topic)",
      placeholder: "contains (Subtitle, :topic)",
      comments: "The filter expression for the query.",
      key: "filterExpression",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Filter Expression",
    },
    {
      required: false,
      example: "Season = :s and Episode > :e",
      placeholder: "Season = :s and Episode > :e",

      key: "keyConditionExpression",
      type: "string",
      default: "",

        "The DynamoDB data type for each query param. You must specify a type for each Expression Attribute Value you provided.",

      key: "tableName",

  ]}

### Update Item

  inputs={[
    {
      required: true,
      key: "awsConnection",
      type: "connection",
      label: "Connection",
    },
    {
      placeholder: "AWS Region",
      required: false,
      comments:
        "AWS provides services in multiple regions, like us-west-2 or eu-west-1.",

        {
          label: "af-south-1",

          label: "ap-southeast-3",

          value: "eu-north-1",

        {

        },
        {
          label: "eu-south-2",
          value: "eu-south-2",

        {
          label: "eu-west-1",

        {
          label: "eu-west-2",

          label: "us-west-1",

        },
        {
          label: "us-west-2",
          value: "us-west-2",
        },
      ],
      key: "awsRegion",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "AWS Region",
    },
    {
      required: false,
      example: "Price > :limit",
      key: "conditionExpression",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Condition Expression",
    },
    {
      required: true,
      example: "set Title = :t, Subtitle = :s'",
      comments:
        "An update expression specifies how UpdateItem will modify the attributes of an item. For example, setting a scalar value or removing elements from a list or a map.",
      key: "query",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Update Expression",
    },
    {
      required: true,
      comments:
        "Expression attribute values in Amazon DynamoDB are substitutes for the actual values that you want to compare—values that you might not know until runtime. An expression attribute value must begin with a colon (:) and be followed by one or more alphanumeric characters.",
      key: "queryParams",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      collection: "keyvaluelist",
      label: "Expression Attribute Values",
    },
    {
      required: true,
      model: [
        {
          label: "String",
          value: "S",
        },
        {
          label: "Number",
          value: "N",
        },
        {
          label: "Buffer",
          value: "B",
        },
        {
          label: "List/Array",
          value: "L",
        },
        {
          label: "Map/Object",
          value: "M",
        },
        {
          label: "String Set",
          value: "SS",
        },
        {
          label: "Number Set",
          value: "NS",
        },
        {
          label: "Buffer Set",
          value: "BS",
        },
        {
          label: "Boolean",
          value: "BOOL",
        },
      ],
      comments:
        "The DynamoDB data type for each query param. You must specify a type for each Expression Attribute Value you provided.",
      key: "queryParamTypes",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      collection: "keyvaluelist",
      label: "Expression Attribute Value Types",
    },
    {
      required: false,
      example: "Acme Inc",
      comments:
        "The value of the optional range key (sort key) to match. This is required if your table has a range key.",
      key: "rangeKeyValue",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Range / Sort Key Value",
    },
    {
      required: true,
      example: "Customers",
      comments:
        "Provide the name of the table you would like to interact with.",
      key: "tableName",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Table Name",
    },
    {
      required: true,
      example: "cust_1234",
      comments: "The value of the hash key (primary key) to match",
      key: "value",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Hash / Primary Key Value",
    },
  ]}
/>

<hr className="componentActionSeparator" />

<div id="createitem" />

### Upsert Item

Creates a new item, or replaces an existing item with a new item | <small><b>key: createItem</b></small>

      default: "",

    },
    {
      required: true,
      example: "Customers",

        "Provide the name of the table you would like to interact with.",
      key: "tableName",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Table Name",
    },
  ]}
/>

You must specify a datatype alongside each property you insert.
Composer will attempt to coerce the inputs you provide to the correct type upon execution.
You can specify the datatype of your input with the `Value Type` input on the create and update item actions.
Be sure to pass the correct format into the input, below is a list of types that DynamoDB will expect.
S = string, N = number, B = buffer, BOOL = boolean, M = map/object, L = array, SS = string set, NS = number set, BS = buffer set

<hr className="componentActionSeparator" />
